TopicTitle: Does anybody have a list of planet info in the Kerbal system

Articles.Content:
I want a list of each planets speed at per and apo, to best time my transfers for efficient dv. And the needed difference in v i will need to get me into an orbit

Or is there an equation to work out orbital speeds at specific altitudes so I can make the list?

Edited October 26, 2015 by leocrumb

Well there are a number of mods that will help you with this. if you get KER you get a dV readout both in flight and in editor. Transfer w planner let's you figure out the dV requirements for any given transfer.

The wiki has orbital speeds for each planet (min/max), along with all the other orbital parameters.

Here's a link to a fantastic delta-V map you can use for mission planning: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/96985-1-0-4-WAC-s-Delta-V-Map-continued-2-2-(Aug-13th)-Swash-transition

Wikipedia has a short article on orbital speed here, complete with equations: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orbital_speed
If you are looking for a stock option you could search google for dV charts, although I don't know whether there are any up to date ones

The KSP wiki has a ton of detailed information on each of the planets and moons, including orbital velocities.

http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Category:Celestials

The wiki also has information about phase angles to make transfers, though I usually just have Kerbal Alarm Clock tell me transfer windows.

I dont think u understand what I mean? I fopund its called the visa viva equation. has anyone done a list of these for each planets peri and apo?

Found it its called orbital velocity in the Wiki thx retread
Keep in mind the equation tells you your actual dV consumption only if you burn prograde/retrograde. It's not possible if the target orbit is inclined.
